basics.name: Sergio Acosta Quintana
basics.label: Backend Software Engineer | Java & Distributed Systems
basics.summary: Backend Engineer specializing in high-availability Java microservices and event-driven architectures. Modernized enterprise systems at IKEA, improving latency, reliability, and operational efficiency. Focused on distributed systems, cloud infrastructure (AWS), and CI/CD automation. Experienced in Clean Architecture, Domain-Driven Design, and production-grade system design.

work.name: IKEA / BITBOX S.L.
highlights: Architected high-throughput Spring Boot microservices for IKEA's loyalty platform processing 2M+ monthly transactions for 400k+ users with 99.9% uptime.

Led migration from PL/SQL monoliths to Event-Driven Architecture with Apache Kafka (15+ topics, 50k+ daily events), replacing 7 manual batch jobs via GitHub Actions automation, reducing processing time 55%.
Built retail insurance sales platform integrating multiple providers (Maffrey, Adeslas) into unified microservices manager with Kafka-based communication, JWT auth, and RBAC.

projects.name: NEXO CLOUD (SaaS)
highlights: Designed production RAG system on Hetzner VPS with Cloudflare R2, PostgreSQL (PG Vector), and Redis. Processes 30k+ docs monthly across multi-tenant environments.
Implemented event-driven pipeline (1k+ docs/hour, p99 <200ms) with dead letter queues, idempotent consumers, and automated backups on own-managed infrastructure.
Integrated OpenAI API with query optimization, index tuning, and batch processing, cutting costs 30%. Built React monitoring dashboard with Tailwind.

education.institution: University of Las Palmas de Gran Canaria
